result.execSummary:
The defendant Neil J Rhode was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS elibible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 206 days sentence credit.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Fine is to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Waukesha Police Department.  Court costs and Blood draw costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental health evaluation and follow through.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
FIRST 90 DAYS:  To be served Straight Time, commencing forthwith.
BALANCE:  To be served Non-working hours (Huber) with all Standard Release Conditions.

Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Neil J Rhode in court, in custody(Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Donna Jean Kuchler by Atty. Chri Erhfurth.

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.


Court orders the following:  
Total Prison:  4.5 Years.
Initial Confinement:  2.5 Years.
Extended Supervision: 2 Years.
206 Days Credit.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

30 Months D/L REVOCATION
30 Months IGNITION INTERLOCK

Term of Probation:  3 Years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.  
Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel during the period of probation.
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
Mental health evaluation and follow through.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 (to be paid to City of Waukesha Police Department);
FINE:  $1,519
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME:
7 Months in the Waukesha County Jail.
First 90 days to be served in the Jail.
Balance to be served with huber (all standard releae conditions).
Forthwith.

OTHER:  Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
